course_title: Frsh Seminar: African Studies: Humanitarian Inter.SexualViol.
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 4 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as WGS 190 1 )
We examine the work of humanitarian organizations involved in trying to give aid to victims of sexual violence in wartime, with a particular focus on Africa. Major topics include the use of rape in the conflict in Rwanda; attempts by local and international organizations such as the United Nations, V-Day and Doctors without Borders to address sexual violence; and critiques of humanitarian and development aid.  Films, books, articles, and primary documents from the United Nations and international humanitarian organizations serve as our main source material.  This class is run as a participatory seminar. You are expected to do all the reading and to come to class ready to engage.
course_description: Introduces first-year students to the interdisciplinary field of African Studies, including historical context, sources, and methods of inquiry; aims to improve critical reading, analytical, and writing skills in small group discussion.
